## File Format

### CSV (Comma-separated values) vs. xlsx (Excel)

Many administrative data (e.g. CPS) are also provided in .sav (SPSS), .dta (Stata), .sas7bdat (SAS).

|                          |   CSV   | XSLX  |
|--------------------------|:-------:|:-----:|
| Size                     | Small\* | Big\* |
| Processing Speed         |  Fast   |       |
| Multiple Sheets          |   No    |  Yes  |
| Formatting (Colors, etc) |   No    |  Yes  |
|                          |         |       |

\*For larger raw data, csv may be bigger, but still processed at a faster speed. \# D

Using R, exporting data (115,112 x 179 dimension) in either csv or xlsx format to OneDrive and Box:

|          |  CSV  | XSLX  |
|----------|:-----:|:-----:|
| OneDrive | 12.82 | 26.40 |
| Box      | 16.03 | 30.52 |
*average of 100 iterations shown
